do_copy_modes(line)[source]¶

Copy maxwell modes from one theory to another. Both theories may live inside different applications and/or datasets

Usage:

copymodes App1.SetA.TheoryI App2.SetB.TheoryJ

Arguments:

  • line {str} – Origin (App.Dataset.Theory) Destination (App.Dataset.Theory)

do_del(name)¶

Delete an open application. By hitting TAB, all the currently open applications are shown.

Arguments:

  • name {str} – Application to delete

Arguments:

  • name {str} – Application to delete

do_quit(args)[source]¶

Exit RepTate.

do_switch(line)[source]¶

Set focus to an open application/set/theory/tool. Argument: name – applicaton/set/theory/tool to switch the focus to (hit TAB to complete)

Show a tree structure of all open applications, tools, datasets and theories

Basic Cmd Console that is inherited by most Reptate objects

calcmode = 1¶
cmdloop(intro='')[source]¶

Repeatedly issue a prompt, accept input, parse an initial prefix off the received input, and dispatch to action methods, passing them the remainder of the line as argument.

complete_console(text, line, begidx, endidx)[source]¶
complete_loglevel(text, line, begidx, endidx)[source]¶
completedefault(text, line, begidx, endidx)[source]¶

Method called to complete an input line when no command-specific complete_*() method is available.

By default, it returns an empty list.

default(line)[source]¶

Called on an input line when the command prefix is not recognized. In that case we execute the line as Python code.

do_EOF(args)[source]¶

Exit Console and Return to Parent or exit

do_console(line)[source]¶

Print/Set current & available Console modes

  • console –> print current mode

  • console available –> print available modes

  • console [cmdline, batch, GUI] –> Set the console mode to [cmdline, batch, GUI]

Arguments:

  • [line] {str} – available, cmdline, batch, GUI

DataSet¶

Module DataSet

Module that describes the basic container for data sets (sets of experimental data read from different files), as well as the particular theories that are being applied to that data set.

Examples:

sort Mw,reverse sort T

Arguments:

  • reverse – The files will be sorted in reverse order

class RepTate.core.FileType.TXTColumnFile(name='TXTColumn', extension='txt', description='Generic text file with columns', col_names=[], basic_file_parameters=[], col_units=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

Basic class for text-column based data files

Columns should be separated by espaces or tabs

BASIC Structure of FILE:

LINE    CONTENTS
0       Param1=434;Param2=4355;
1       # Header line and/or comments [OPTIONAL, ANY NUMBER OF HEADER LINES IS POSSIBLE]
2       col1 col2 col3 [NAMES OF COLUMNS, OPTIONAL]
3       4343 434.5 535e-434 [DATA, ONLY NUMBERS ALLOWED]

The following examples can be declared with the line:

ftype=TXTColumnFile("LVE files", "tts", "LVE files", ['w','G'','G'''], ['Mw','T'], ['rad/s','Pa','Pa'])

EXAMPLE 1: columns line, no header lines:

C1=8.77210163229153;C2=114.03;Rho0=0.928;C3=0.61;T=-35;CTg=14.65;dx12=0;isof=true;Mw=634.5;chem=PI;PDI=1.03;
w                           G'                          G''                        T                            g
4.29882628773180E-0008      1.44001856995549E+0002      3.70207627600662E+0003     -3.30000000000000E-0003      0.00000000000000E+0000
6.30767835406968E-0008      2.56947504513849E+0002      5.39032089470917E+0003      3.14760000000000E-0004      0.00000000000000E+0000
9.25946098215800E-0008      4.87031807130633E+0002      7.86538338583378E+0003     -1.01000000000000E-0002      0.00000000000000E+0000

EXAMPLE 2: Neither columns line nor header lines:

C1=8.77210163229153;C2=114.03;Rho0=0.928;C3=0.61;T=-35;CTg=14.65;dx12=0;isof=true;Mw=23.4;chem=PI;PDI=1.03;
2.42782390212358E-0003      2.11182193155015E+0001      1.72559181398615E+0003      1.25000000000000E-0003      0.00000000000000E+0000
3.56351666244471E-0003      4.30476548641552E+0001      2.53490824331357E+0003      1.48400000000000E-0002      0.00000000000000E+0000

EXAMPLE 3: 2 Header lines, no column line:

T=160;chem=PE;
# Header 1
# Header 2
4.23333e-05 1.05E+00 2.96E+01
6.7e-05 2.02E+00 3.97E+01

EXAMPLE 4: 2 Header lines + column line:

T=160;chem=PE;
# Header 1
# Header 2
w G' G''
4.23333e-05 1.05E+00 2.96E+01
6.7e-05 2.02E+00 3.97E+01

Parameter¶

Module Parameter

Module that defines theory parameters and their properties.

class RepTate.core.Parameter.OptType[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Store the optimization type that can be used in a Theory

Parameters can be:

  • opt: Optimized at the next minimization

  • nopt: Not optimized at the next minimization

  • const: Not allowed to be minimized

const = 3¶
nopt = 2¶
opt = 1¶
class RepTate.core.Parameter.Parameter(name='', value=0, description='', type=<ParameterType.real: 0>, opt_type=<OptType.opt: 1>, min_value=-inf, max_value=inf, display_flag=True, discrete_values=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract class to describe theory parameters

[description]

copy(par2)[source]¶

Copy the contents of another parameter

[description]

Arguments:

  • par2 {[type]} – [description]

class RepTate.core.Parameter.ParameterType[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Types of parameters that can be used in a Theory

Parameters can be:

  • real: Any real number

  • integer: Any integer number

  • discrete_real: It can take a value only from a discrete set of prescribed real values

  • discrete_integer: It can take a value only from a discrete set of prescribed integer values

  • bool: The parameter is a flag

boolean = 4¶
discrete_integer = 3¶
discrete_real = 2¶
integer = 1¶
real = 0¶
string = 5¶

Theory¶

Module Theory

Module that defines the basic structure and properties of a theory.

exception RepTate.core.Theory.EndComputationRequested[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Exception class to end computations

class RepTate.core.Theory.ErrorCalculationMethod[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Method to determine the error of a theory calculation.

Options are:

  • View1: Use current view number 1 in the application.

  • RawData: Use the data table as defined by the application.

  • AllViews: Use all active views.

AllViews = 2¶
RawData = 1¶
View1 = 0¶
class RepTate.core.Theory.MLStripper[source]¶

Bases: html.parser.HTMLParser

Remove HTML tags from string

get_data()[source]¶
handle_data(d)[source]¶
class RepTate.core.Theory.MinimizationMethod[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Method used during minimization

Parameters can be:

  • ls: Non-linear Least Squares (default)

  • basinhopping: Basin-hopping method

  • dualannealing: Dual-Annealing method

  • diffevol: Differential Evolution method

  • SHGO: simplicial homology global optimization

  • bruteforce: Find the minimum on a hypergrid

SHGO = 4¶
basinhopping = 1¶
bruteforce = 5¶
descriptions = ['Non-linear Least Squares', 'Basin-hopping method', 'Dual-Annealing', 'Differential Evolution', 'Simplicial Homology Global Optimization', 'Find the minimum on a hypergrid']¶
diffevol = 3¶
dualannealing = 2¶
ls = 0¶
types = ['ls', 'basinhopping', 'dualannealing', 'diffevol', 'SHGO', 'bruteforce']¶

complete_save(text, line, begidx, endidx)[source]¶

Complete the save command

default(line)[source]¶

Called when the input command is not recognized

Called on an input line when the command prefix is not recognized. Check if there is an = sign in the line. If so, it is a parameter change. Else, we execute the line as Python code.

Arguments:

  • line {[type]} – [description]

description = ''¶

description {str} – Description of theory

destructor()[source]¶

If the theory needs to erase some memory in a special way, any child theory must rewrite this funcion

do_calculate(line, timing=True)[source]¶

Calculate the theory

do_cite(line)[source]¶

Print citation information

do_copy_modes(line)[source]¶

Copy Maxwell modes from another theory

do_error(line)[source]¶

Report the error of the current theory

Report the error of the current theory on all the files, taking into account the current selected xrange and yrange.

File error is calculated as the mean square of the residual, averaged over all points in the file. Total error is the mean square of the residual, averaged over all points in all files.

do_error_interpolated(line)[source]¶

Report the error of the current theory This routine works when the theory and the experimental data are not measured on the same points

do_file(line)[source]¶

Print the theory table associated with the given file name

do_xrange(line, visible=None)[source]¶

Set/show xrange for fit and shows limits. Arguments: limits of the span. With no arguments: switches ON/OFF the horizontal span. Example: xrange -4 5

do_yrange(line, visible=None)[source]¶

Set/show yrange for fit and shows limits

With no arguments: switches ON/OFF the vertical span

Arguments:

  • line {[ymin ymax]} – Sets the limits of the span

precmd(line)[source]¶

Calculations before the theory is calculated

This function could be erased This method is called after the line has been input but before it has been interpreted. If you want to modifdy the input line before execution (for example, variable substitution) do it here.

class RepTate.core.View.ViewMode[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Defines how to show the experimental/theoretical data view TO BE DONE…

Parameters can be:

  • symbol: Show symbols (default for experimental data – files in the dataset)

  • line: Show lines (default for theories)

  • bar: Show bars

bar = 2¶
line = 1¶
symbol = 0¶
